insurance.payer_name: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Illinois

encounter.chief_complaint: Right ear pain x 2 days, fever

history_of_present_illness.narrative: 4-year-old male presents with 2-day history of right ear pain. Father reports patient has been pulling at his right ear and has been increasingly fussy. Fever noted at home (101.2°F). Associated symptoms include decreased appetite and difficulty sleeping. Recent URI symptoms 5 days ago (runny nose, mild cough) now resolving. No vomiting, diarrhea, or rash. No history of ear infections. Immunizations up to date.
history_of_present_illness.recent_illness: Upper respiratory infection (5 days prior, resolving)

physical_exam.general: Alert, active, mildly fussy but consolable. Well-nourished, well-developed male in no acute distress.

heent.head: Normocephalic, atraumatic

ears.right: TM erythematous and bulging with decreased mobility on pneumatic otoscopy. Purulent effusion visible behind TM. External canal normal.
ears.left: TM pearly gray with normal light reflex and mobility. No effusion.

heent.throat: Oropharynx mildly erythematous, no exudate, tonsils 2+ bilaterally

physical_exam.neck: Supple, no lymphadenopathy, no meningeal signs
physical_exam.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes/rales/rhonchi
physical_exam.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, capillary refill <2 seconds
physical_exam.abdomen: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, normal bowel sounds
physical_exam.neurological: Alert and oriented, moves all extremities, no focal deficits

medication.name: Acetaminophen (Children's Tylenol)
medication.instructions: 7.5 mL every 4-6 hours as needed for pain or fever. Do not exceed 5 doses in 24 hours.

discharge_instructions: Give Amoxicillin 400mg (5mL) by mouth twice daily for 10 days. Complete entire course even if feeling better.
Give Tylenol (acetaminophen) 240mg (7.5mL) every 4-6 hours as needed for pain or fever.
Keep ear dry - no swimming until cleared by doctor.
Follow up with pediatrician in 10-14 days or sooner if symptoms worsen.
Return to ER if: fever above 104°F, severe headache, stiff neck, persistent vomiting, ear drainage, or symptoms worsen despite antibiotics after 48-72 hours.
